```{r include = TRUE}
# Create the data frame with the necessary columns
overview_table <- data.frame(
  Citation = character(),
  Study_Design = character(),
  Population = character(),
  Methods = character(),
  Key_Findings = character(),
  Neural_Regions_Networks = character(),
  Impact_on_Academic_Performance = character(),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

colnames(overview_table) <- c(
  "Citation",
  "Study Design",
  "Population",
  "Methods",
  "Key Findings",
  "Neural Regions/Networks",
  "Impact on Academic Performance"
)

# Example entry for manual filling (you will need to fill these with the actual data)
overview_table[1, ] <- c(
  "Beilock et al. (2007)",
  "Experimental",
  "100 college students, mixed gender",
  "Behavioral tasks, fMRI",
  "Stereotype threat impairs working memory efficiency",
  "Prefrontal cortex, phonological loop",
  "Reduced performance on cognitive tasks under threat"
)

# Calculate adjusted column widths to fit within 27cm
column_widths <- c("2cm", "3cm", "4cm", "3cm", "3cm", "4cm", "4cm")

# Construct the align string
align_string <- paste0("p{", column_widths, "}")

# Use apa_table to create the table with adjusted column widths
apa_table(
  overview_table,
  caption = "Overview of the Included Papers for Hypothesis 1",
  escape = FALSE,
  landscape = T,
  align = align_string,
  font_size = "small"
)
```
